thread.title: Playfab Hosting Seattle Game Jam Competition To Bring Region's Game Developers Together
thread.title_full: Playfab Hosting Seattle Game Jam Competition To Bring Region's Game Developers Together

author: admin
title: Playfab Hosting Seattle Game Jam Competition To Bring Region's Game Developers Together
text:
Submitted by admin on 9/29/2015 @ 9:00 AM   PlayFab 
SEATTLE, Sept. 29, 2015 /PRNewswire/ -- What: Seattle-based game development technology company, PlayFab, is hosting a Seattle Game Jam the weekend of Friday, October 9 - Sunday, October 11. Taking place at SURF Incubator, more than one hundred game developers from throughout the region are expected to participate in the friendly competition - pitting teams of game developers, designers, industry professionals and students against each other to create the most interesting and engaging game possible over a short three-day period. Game devs of all experience levels are encouraged to take part in the jam-packed weekend, which will bring together industry professionals from a variety of backgrounds from indie studios to major developers. Under the theme "It's Alive," the event will have a special emphasis on creating online and cross-platform games. Free to participate, attendees will have a chance at taking home more than $500 in prizes, and bragging rights for a judges' and peoples' choice award as well as a special students' award for outstanding work from up and coming developers. With the local games industry now employing more than 17,000 people in Washington, PlayFab is celebrating a group of professionals that help pump more than $36 billion into the local economy. For more information and to sign up to participate, visit: https://www.eventbrite.co.uk/e/seattle-game-jam- tickets-18262010164 When: Friday, October 9 - Sunday, October 11 Key media times include: Idea Pitch - Friday @ 6pm Judging & Awards - Sunday @ 5pm Where: SURF Incubator 999 3rd Avenue #700 Seattle, WA 98104 Who: PlayFab's CEO and games industry veteran, James Gwertzman, will be on-site all weekend and available for interviews to discuss the event, Seattle's significant indie games scene, and what it means to be a part of one of the region's fastest growing industries. James will be joined on the judging panel by three Seattle games industry elites, including - Matt Augustine, CTO of PlayFab and skilled games technology professional /Adam Lieb, CEO of Innervate and gaming community expert /Lisa Weeks, local marketing maven and entertainment industry vet - who will be available for interview on Sunday afternoon. 
To view the original version on PR Newswire, visit: http://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/playfab-hosting-seattle-game-jam-competition-to-bring-regions-game-developers-together-300150810.html 
SOURCE PlayFab
